content:
Convert 5 yards to feet using the following formula:
1 yard = 3 feet
What is the result of this conversion in [ Latex ] format?

To convert 5 yards to feet using the formula \(1 \text{ yard} = 3 \text{ feet}\), you multiply the number of yards by 3:

\[ 5 \text{ yards} \times 3 \frac{\text{feet}}{\text{yard}} = 15 \text{ feet} \]

In LaTeX format, the result is:

\[ 5 \text{ yards} \times 3 \text{ feet/yard} = 15 \text{ feet} \]

So, the conversion is:

\[ 5 \text{ yards} = 15 \text{ feet} \]
